Articles.Content: Hello, I play the KSP Demo (I want to be perfect on the demo before I buy the full version). After several successes at achieving a very low Mun orbit and returning to Kerbin, I want to land on the Mun. I have putted Three LT-1 struts but it is affecting my balance in the launch. It doesn't matter if the struts are lowered or not. Any suggestions?

I'd need to take a look at your craft (screenshot or craft file) to know for sure, but it sounds like they haven't been placed symmetrically - if you don't place things symmetrically around the central axis it's going to throw off the rocket's balance and make its flight unstable. Doesn't matter what part it is.

I'll suggest removing the struts you have, changing the symmetry control to 3x and reattaching. If that doesn't help, try 4x.

Again, a screenshot would be helpful here.

(I also started with the demo, BTW).
If you have used the symmetry button when placing your landing struts, you shouldn't be having a problem. Maybe there is something else wrong with your craft.
